name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: This is like iPhone Footloose and theres no Kevin Bacon to save us.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Half the people who use TikTok do believe it poses a threat to national security, but they still use it on their phones. I guess at this point, what the hell, right? Half the country supports a national security threat for president, might as well dance.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: These are not running mates, they’re who the people on The Masked Singer call when Rob Schneider says no.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: [RFK Jr.] is also considering a pair of Truck Nutz dipped in Ivermectin.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: How many losing teams can [Rodgers] be a part of at once?

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: ‘Shadow-banned’ is code for ‘all your high school classmates have you muted.'

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Well, if you guys are worried about the Chinese gathering information about Americans, wait ’til you hear who makes the phones.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Dude, you’re 77. Those should be your favorite things right now. And, let’s be honest, you could use the cash.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: [On Biden investigator Robert Hur’s disastrous appearance before a congressional hearing into discrepancies between his summary and the actual transcript] “He reportedly got help from right-wing operatives connected to Donald Trump to prepare for his testimony yesterday. Although I can’t imagine what kind of advice he got from Trumpworld. Did they show him Trump’s courtroom sketches to prepare? ‘Okay, the best way to make yourself seem credible and trustworthy during testimony is to grimace like you’re passing a gallstone, grimace like you’re passing a second, bigger gallstone, grimace like you just saw your wife having sex with Grimace, then just hold your hands up like you’re waiting for them to slap the cuffs on you.’” seth meyers

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Trump had more than 300 classified documents scattered around an active social club with over 150 employees, where anyone can pay to be a member or attend a social event like a fundraiser or a wedding or a pre-funeral for Rudy Giuliani.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Elon Musk today visited the Tesla factory in Germany which suspended operations earlier this month after a suspected arson attack. Why would an arsonist waste their time? If you want a Tesla to catch fire, you know, just wait a few minutes.

name: Desi Lydic
monologue: What’s interesting here is how unpredictable the breakdown of the vote was. Marjorie Taylor Green and AOC voted together against the bill, Nancy Pelosi and Lauren Boebert voted for it. Both nightmare blunt rotations, by the way.

name: Desi Lydic
monologue: That’s how you know this issue is important, it forced Gen Z to make their very first phone call.

name: Desi Lydic
monologue: And you know congressmen must have been pissed with teenagers blowing up their phones all day. I mean, well, Matt Gaetz didn’t mind.

name: Desi Lydic
monologue: Don’t forget, Aaron Rodgers is supposed to be the starting quarterback for the Jets next season, so the question is, what’s he going to do if the Jets make it to the Super Bowl. [Pause, followed by laughter.] I almost held it together.

name: Desi Lydic
monologue: Donald Trump has also been looking at potential Vice Presidents. He’s focus-grouping their appeal, feeling them out on policy, seeing how soft their lips feel on his ass.

name: Desi Lydic
monologue: This might be the first time a woman has had to fly into Texas to see a doctor.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Then Alexa was like, ‘Yeah, TikTok, that’s the one thats spying on you. Ban it, ban it.'

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: RFK Jr. was like, ‘Do you want to give it a shot?’ And Rodgers said, ‘No, but I will give it a horse-dewormer.'

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Kennedy confirmed that Rodgers and Ventura are at the top of his list. Which makes you wonder who’s at the bottom, William Hung and the ‘Can you hear me now?’ guy?

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: The CEO of Petco is stepping down… He held the job for five years, or 35 in Petco CEO years.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Now that is a risky move to pick Rodgers, because, if we’ve learned one thing, when he starts running, he’s gonna snap his Achilles.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Now, this would not be the first presidential ticket to embrace psychedelic drugs. I mean, who can forget William Henry Harrison’s 1840 campaign: ‘Trippy Canoe and Spiders, AHHHH!!!!'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Well folks, the inevitable has inevited.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: It’s like if Muhammad Ali fought Joe Frazier—now.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Yesterday, Trump unveiled a nifty new legal strategy, informing the court that he’ll argue that he didn’t commit any wrongdoing because his lawyers were involved in the incident. Yes, that’s a little-known loophole—if there’s a lawyer there, nothing is a crime.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: [Trump] recently replace the RNC leadership with his cronies, including daughter-in-law and plastic surgery who’s had some woman done, Lara Trump.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Lara’s credentials to run a major party organization include ‘none.'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Sure Lara Trump may not be qualified. She many not have experience doing… things. But she has done what no one thought was possible, she married Eric Trump.

name: Michael Kosta
monologue: That’s right, Aaron Rodgers could be RFK Jr’s running mate. This would be the best President and Vice President pairing of all time, is what I’m assuming measles virus is saying.

name: Michael Kosta
monologue: A football player in the White House feels like progress, through. We don’t need any more aging old men with brain problems. We need strong young men with brain problems.

name: Michael Kosta
monologue: I just don’t know if Rodgers is qualified to be next in line for the presidency. But I guess we don’t need to worry about that—I mean, when has a Kennedy ever died unexpectedly.

name: Michael Kosta
monologue: Yesterday, Joe Biden and Donald Trump both secured enough delegates to clinch their parties’ nomination. Making this officially a three-man race Between Trump, Biden, and natural causes.
